ExampleDefinition.Title: Impulse (Stem) chart
ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Generates an Impulse-reseponse style chart with optional point-marker in code
ExampleDefinition.Description:
[b]Impulse Series chart[/b]
Generates an Impulse-response style chart with optional point-marker in code. The [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/The%20Impulse%20Chart%20Type.html']FastImpulseRenderableSeries[/url] can be used to render an [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.XyDataSeries%602.html']XyDataSeries[/url], [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.XyyDataSeries%602.html']XyyDataSeries[/url] (uses Y1 only) or [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.OhlcDataSeries%602.html']OhlcDataSeries[/url] (renders close).
[b][i]Tip! [/i][/b] [i]You can add optional data-point markers to a impulse series using the [/i][url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/Point%20Marker%20API%20-%20BaseRenderableSeries.Pointmarker.html']PointMarker API[/url][i]. This is very performant and uses the same bitmap rendering as our Scatter-Charts.[/i]
[b]Documentation Links[/b]
